intro: Dutaillyea comptonii, commonly known as the Compton's dutaillyea, is a rare and unique flowering plant native to specific regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its distinctive, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in sunny, arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and leathery, while its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a mix of white and yellow hues. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Dutaillyea comptonii is considered a vulnerable species.
